response.answer_text: Digital technology was not the invention of a single person. There were several people among hundreds who made key contribiutions: Boole, Shannon, Turing, and Von Neumann.     George Boole. Inventor of Boolean logic (binary algebra) George Boole - Wikipedia Claude Shannon. Inventor of electronic circuits that can perform Boolean logic mechanically. Claude Shannon - Wikipedia Alan Turing. Inventor of the Turing machine, a conceptual model of a programmable logic processor. Alan Turing - Wikipedia John Von Neumann. Construction of digital computers with modifiable stored instructions and data. John von Neumann - Wikipedia
